IV/M.3185 - VICTOR RIJSSEN / KON. VOLKER WESSELS STEVIN) op grond van Verordening (EEG) nr. 4064/89 van de Raad (Slechts de tekst in de Nederlandse taal is authentiek) Publicatieblad Nr. 150 van 27/06/2003 blz. 0002 - 0002 Beschikking van de Commissie van 18/06/2003 waarbij een concentratie verenigbaar met de gemeenschappelijke markt wordt verklaard (Zaak nr. IV/M.3185 - VICTOR RIJSSEN / KON. VOLKER WESSELS STEVIN) op grond van Verordening (EEG) nr. 4064/89 van de Raad (Slechts de tekst in de Nederlandse taal is authentiek) To the notifying party Dear Sirs, Subject: Case No. COMP/M.3185 - Victor Rijssen / Koninklijke Volker Wessels Stevin Notification of 14.05.2003 pursuant to Article 4 of Council Regulation (EEC) No. 4064/89 [1] [1]   OJ L 395, 30.12.1989 p. 1; corrected version OJ L 257 of 21.9.1990, p. 13, as last amended by Regulation (EC) No 1310/97, OJ L 180, 9.7.1997, p. 1, corrigendum in OJ L 40, 13.2.1998, p. 17. Publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities No. C 120, page 19 of 22/05/2003. 1. On 14.05.2003, the Commission received a notification of a proposed concentration pursuant to Article 4 of Council Regulation (EEC) No 4064/89 by which the undertaking Victor Rijssen B.V. ("Victor Rijssen", The Netherlands) belonging to the Reggeborgh group ("Reggeborgh", The Netherlands) acquires within the meaning of Article 3(1)(b) of the Council Regulation control of the whole of the undertaking Koninklijke Volker Wessels Stevin N.V. ("KVWS", The Netherlands) by way of a public bid announced on 22.04.2003. 2. The business activities of the undertakings concerned are: - for Reggeborgh: investment in several sectors such as management and development of real estate, contracting business, travel business, media, telecommunication and agriculture. - for KVWS: development and building of business premises, infrastructure and other building projects. 3. After examination of the notification, the Commission has concluded that the notified operation falls within the scope of Council Regulation (EEC) No. 4064/89 and of paragraph 4, subparagraph c, of the Commission Notice on a simplified procedure for treatment of certain concentrations under Council Regulation (EEC) No 4064/89 [2]. [2]   OJ C 217, 29.07.2000, p. 32. 4. For the reasons set out in the Notice on a simplified procedure, the Commission has decided not to oppose the notified operation and to declare it compatible with the common market and with the EEA Agreement.  This decision is adopted in application of Article 6(1)(b) of Council Regulation (EEC) No. 4064/89. For the Commission (signed) Mario MONTI Member of the Commission
